DOC.brief_title: Safety Efficacy MK-1439A Participants Infected With Treatment-Naïve Human Immunodeficiency Virus ( HIV ) -1 With Transmitted Resistance ( MK-1439A-030 )
DOC.criteria: Is HIV1 positive within 45 day prior treatment phase study , HIV treatment indicate base physician assessment . Is naïve antiretroviral therapy ( ART ) include investigational antiretroviral agent . Prior screening , genotype perform confirm presence one follow NNRTI mutation : K103N , Y181C , G190A . Is consider clinically stable sign symptom active infection time entry study ( i.e . clinical status chronic medication unchanged least 2 week prior start treatment study ) . Is highly unlikely become pregnant impregnate partner Is user recreational illicit drug recent history drug alcohol abuse dependence . Has treat viral infection HIV1 , hepatitis B , agent active HIV1 , include , limited , adefovir , tenofovir , entecavir , emtricitabine , lamivudine . Has document know resistance study drug ( MK1439 , lamivudine , and/or tenofovir ) Has participate anticipates participate study investigational compound/device within 30 day prior sign inform consent Has medical condition requiring , likely require , chronic systemic administration corticosteroid , tumor necrosis factor ( TNF ) antagonists , immunosuppressant drug course trial . Requires anticipate require prohibit medication Has significant hypersensitivity contraindication component study drug Has current ( active ) diagnosis acute hepatitis due cause Has evidence decompensated liver disease liver cirrhosis ChildPugh Class C score PughTurcotte ( CPT ) score > 9 Is pregnant , breastfeeding , expect conceive Is female expect donate egg , male expect donate sperm time study
